subject: AGRICULTURE
text: Explain what is meant by sand and clay in relation to soils,

subject: AGRICULTURE
question: 1. b
text: Indicate briefly how you could determine approximately in the laboratory the percentage of water and humus in a sample of soil.

subject: AGRICULTURE
question: 1. c
text: Give, with reasons, a rotation which is suitable for a light soil, and one which is suitable for a heavy soil. Discuss any other factors which might influence your choice of rotations.

subject: AGRICULTURE
text: Give the chemical formulae of the following substances and explain any connection which they have with agriculture :— calcium bicarbonate, calcium cyanamide, monoealcic phosphate. Calculate from the formulae the percentage of calcium in each of these substances.

subject: AGRICULTURE
question: 2. b
text: Describe how shell lime, ground lime, and ground limestone are prepared and compare the effectiveness of these three forms of lime.

subject: AGRICULTURE
text: Describe laboratory tests to determine whether the following are present in an artificial fertiliser :— calcium, phosphate, potash.

subject: AGRICULTURE
question: 3. b
text: Describe fully the Gerber method of determining the percentage of butter fat in milk.

subject: AGRICULTURE
text: Give a list of the essential food constituents of farm animals and explain the purpose which each constituent serves in animal nutrition.

subject: AGRICULTURE
question: 4. b
text: Explain what is meant by  energy value, starch,  starch equivalent, protein, protein equivalent as applied to feeding stuffs.

subject: AGRICULTURE
text: Make a labelled sketch and give an example of the use in agriculture of four of the following :—- pawl and ratchet gear, differential gear box, cam, governor, hygrometer.

subject: AGRICULTURE
text: Discuss the possible orders of firing in a 4-cylinder 4-stroke internal combusion engine, the cylinders of which are in line.

subject: AGRICULTURE
question: 6. b
text: Show what relation exists in this type of engine between the mean effective pressure in the cylinder, the engine details and dimensions, and the power produced.

subject: AGRICULTURE
text: Explain the meaning and the agricultural significance of five of the following terms :— relative humidity of the atmosphere, the water barometer, anticyclone, kilowatt-hour, ft H value, malleable iron, osmosis.
